blogs.title: 8 Reasons to Learn React with Udacity
blogs.body: In this tutorial, weâ€™re going to create a small Twitter-like mobile app using React Native. With our app, users will be able to create accounts and log in, see a feed of all of the posts created by themselves and other users, and add their own posts to the feed. The data for all of our users and posts will be managed by Cosmic JS.TL;DR View the source code on GitHub Install the app on Cosmic JS (you still need to run locally) Getting Started Youâ€™ll need to have node.js and yarn Iâ€™m also using the Expo SDK so that I donâ€™t have to get Xcode and Android Studio set up. This is also going to provide me with features that will help with things like loading fonts and allowing users to upload photos to the app. To get started with Expo, please refer to the docs.
